headline.main: CONGRESS SHAPING NEUTRALITY FIGHT; Roosevelt Critics Say They Will Oppose Ship Arming Plan to Avert Further Moves

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 -- Battle lines over President Roosevelt's request for authority to arm American merchant ships were forming in Congress today with critics of Administration foreign policy expressing the feeling that they were compelled to make a stand on this issue to ward off further and even more fundamental changes in the Neutrality Act.
abstract: House Foreign Affairs Com limits resolution hearing; Taft on opposition views; Adm expects quick victory; changes opposed by Women United
